course.subject: FINA
course.name: Corporate Finance
course.description: Valuation of cash flow streams (PV of cash flow streams, annuities, and perpetuities); valuation of bonds; valuation of stocks using dividend discount model; capital budgeting decisions (NPV, IRR, payback); capital structure; limits to the use of debt (trade-off models); estimation of cost of debt and equity; WACC; terminal value.

reviews.author: eric123
reviews.comment_content:
Financial Decision Making and the Law of One Price (Chapter 1, 3)
Time Value of Money (Chapter 4)
Interest Rates (Chapter 5)
Investment Decision Rules (Chapter 7)

Financial Statement Analysis (Chapter 2)
Capital Budgeting (Chapter 8)

Bond valuation (Chapter 6)  

Stock valuation (Chapter 9)

Risk, Return, Capital Asset Pricing Model (Chapter 10 & 11)  
Estimating the Cost of Capital (Chapter 12)
reviews.comment_teaching:
- Teaching good, professor is very patient in answering questions
- Also combines learning material with market news
reviews.comment_grading:
- do well on every assignment
- review the sample final exam
- review all the work done on the ppt
- after all, should get a satisfied grade
reviews.comment_workload:
4 assignments + 1 final exam
- have to spend some time finishing the assignment every week

the content of class and homework is easy for master students

reviews.author: aliveine
reviews.comment_content: A condensed version of corporate finance. Taught up to cost of capital. This course can be waived if you passed CFA level 2.
reviews.comment_teaching: Ekkachai is a good teacher. Clear explanation and smooth delivery of class. Interaction is emphasized even class is conducted over zoom. Also recent news will be discussed at the beginning of the class. Try to participate more.
reviews.comment_grading: Due to this course is at postgraduate level, I think the grade distribution is less harsh than undergraduate course. I am ok with my grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Heavy workload, assignment due every week. 4 problem sets and 2 case studies. 1 exam. Optional tutorial sessions to go through the assignment answer of last week.
